# NSRelationshipDescription

**Class**

A description of a relationship between two entities.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSRelationshipDescription
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSRelationshipDescription] provides additional attributes that are specific to modeling a relationship between two entities. For the common attributes of all property types, see [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSPropertyDescription].

For example, use this class to define a relationship’s *cardinality* — the number of managed objects the relationship can reference.

- For a to-one relationship, set [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSRelationshipDescription/maxCount] to `1`.
- For a to-many relationship, set [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSRelationshipDescription/maxCount] to a number greater than `1` to impose an upper limit; otherwise, use `0` to allow an unlimited number of referenced objects.

At runtime, you can modify a relationship description until you associate its owning managed object model with a persistent store coordinator.  If you attempt to modify the model after you associate it, Core Data throws an exception. To modify a model that’s in use, create and modify a copy and then discard any objects that belong to the original model.

## Configuring the Destination

- **inverseRelationship**: The relationship that represents the inverse of the current relationship.
- **destinationEntity**: The type of object the relationship contains.
- **isOrdered**: A Boolean value that determines whether the relationship preserves the order of the referenced managed objects.

## Configuring Cardinality

- **isToMany**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the relationship can contain many managed objects.
- **minCount**: The minimum number of managed objects the relationship can reference.
- **maxCount**: The maximum number of managed objects the relationship can reference.

## Configuring Delete Behavior

- **deleteRule**: The rule to apply when you delete the relationship’s owning managed object.
- **NSDeleteRule**: Constants that determine what happens when you delete a relationship’s owning managed object.

## Getting Version Data

- **versionHash**: The relationship’s unique identity.

## Standard attributes

- **NSPropertyDescription**: A description of a single property belonging to an entity.
- **NSAttributeDescription**: A description of a single attribute belonging to an entity.
- **NSAttributeType**: The types of attribute that Core Data supports.

## Inherits From

- NSPropertyDescription

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
